info.title: How to use StructGen
info.body:
StructGen takes a plain‑text description and creates folders/files in the selected location.

1. Line basics
- Each line describes one place in the structure.
- Left side before the colon ":" – folder path.
- Right side after the colon – list of files in that path.

2. Folder path
- Folders are separated with "/".
- First segment is the top‑level folder, next ones are nested.
- Example: Pro/etc means folder "Pro" with "etc" inside it.

3. File list
- Files are separated by commas.
- Spaces around names are ignored.
- Example: index.html, main.css

4. Full example
Pro/etc: index.html, main.css
Pro/js: main.js

What will this create?
- Folder "Pro".
- Inside it: folders "etc" and "js".
- In "etc": index.html, main.css.
- In "js": main.js.

Important
- Everything is always created only inside the selected root directory.
- Attempts to go outside root are ignored (counted as "Skipped").
